Is Blizzard a garbage company? Yes. Does Blizzard take advantage of its players? Yes. Does Blizzard make promises to its players and then backtrack 100%? Yes. Do I like Blizzard? No.

However, Overwatch 2 by itself and as a standalone game is pretty fun. Also it is free. Yes, Blizzard tries to gouge its players but really, how is this different than any other company in the world? Why not play the game for free, and not buy anything?

Let's be clear: Overwatch 2 is a free game, with free multiplayer servers. Regardless of what features you think deserve to be in the game, or how much you hate Blizzard, or how butt-hurt you are by broken promises, how can you complain about free? It's polished, it's fun, and it's FREE! You entitled crying monkeys. Get over yourself. If the game didn't run well, or if it had an insane amount of bugs, or just wasn't good, I could see a reason for the 'Negative Review Outcry'. But it runs and looks great! Blizzard is ass but you really can't beat free, and if you're too stupid to not buy pointless cosmetics then you have bigger problems than your hate for a free game.
Its just a bad game. Micro Transaction for everything and only doing the steam release because the player base is dying.

1. I paid $60 for Overwatch on PC when it released. Why are you taking away something I spent money on? I understand why Blizzard feels the need to change the game and make corrections but why strip us of the game we paid for.

2. The new monetization scheme is absolutely horrendous for both new and old players. I mean $20 for a skin that came out 6 years ago and was free with the original OW credits, are you serious? This part feels like a sick joke to us original players and is just flat out disrespectful. The battle pass is also terrible but I‚Äôll get into that.

3. Terrible battle pass system that rewards players for paying and gives the people who don‚Äôt pay practically nothing for playing the game. I understand it‚Äôs a F2P game and skins shouldn‚Äôt be why people play, but it‚Äôs just dumb to force people to pay for the battle pass if the want to earn anything interesting especially since most of us have already bought OW.  Yes new heroes are "free" but free if u take the game as a second job in order to grind to tier 41 in order to get the new hero.

4. Extremely buggy and terrible launch. I don‚Äôt even need to go into detail for this one.

5. Lack of anything new, yes they may have updated UI, added some new heroes and maps, reworked 6v6 into 5v5, and made changes to existing heroes, but why does this need to be an entirely ‚Äúnew‚Äù game? It feels like the same game to me aside from balancing certain things out but honestly the UI is a complete downgrade for me.

6. Lack of new skins and content, I understand that this is more of a nitpick but like why is a skin $20 when it is basically just a re-color of the default skin? This if for multiple heroes too. 
7. Still requiring specific phone numbers for new users. This is stupid. I don‚Äôt even know what else to say I feel like I could go on and on but what‚Äôs the point. Blizzard won‚Äôt listen to me or anyone else because they are a selfish and greedy company that views their fans as nothing more than consumers (which most are). I can‚Äôt help at least writing a review for this game though. Shame on blizzard for this ****
blizzard are genuine scum and this game is missed potential on so many fronts, purely in the name of making more money regardless of how it may negatively affect the game and its consumer base.

I love this game despite my misgivings about blizzard management and activision just being straight up evil.

So this is a difficult one... 
But I'll do my best. Is the game good? Absolutely!
Is the company bad? Absolutely.
Is the game predatory? Absolutely.

But is the experience great? Yes.
Is the world immersive? Yes.
Is the art amazing? Yes.
Does it have a Hero that summons a Fox? YES!

What can I say? Foxes earn my favor.
I recommend not spending money on this game though. Just play it casually and have fun since the gameplay is great.

winton overwat

I'm deeply disappointed with Overwatch 2, and I believe the decision to make a sequel was a complete misstep. Instead of improving upon what already worked in Overwatch 1, the developers chose to strip away many key aspects from the original, which ultimately led to a decline in the gameplay quality.

The promises of a PvE mode, which were supposed to be a central point of Overwatch 2, turned out to be nothing more than a marketing ploy. Rather than delivering a full-fledged and satisfying PvE experience as part of the base game, the developers opted to truncate this mode and sell it in packs for an additional $15. It's a blatant attempt to squeeze extra money from players without delivering anything of real value.

Overall, Overwatch 2 seems to be an attempt to maximize profits from the franchise rather than focusing on delivering satisfaction to fans of the original game. The developers should have concentrated on expanding and refining existing mechanics and content instead of introducing paid add-ons that should rightfully be an integral part of the game.

In conclusion, Overwatch 2 is a classic example of how to tarnish a good brand through greed and poor design decisions. The developers lost touch with what players truly wanted and instead focused on profit extraction, which resulted in a decline in the game's quality and the community's trust.

Ohhh, baby! You know what time it is? A reality check time!

I am not even going to play it after these rough years this game being on Bnet.  Bad decisions after bad decisions, also outright canceling both their own casual and competitive scenes.

I just want to download it, get in the target practice to give me a valid playtime to review, give it a thumb down, and then uninstall it. Thank you Blizzard, for putting this game on Steam so people can express their frustration freely in a nice percentage fashion.

And... uninstalled.

My favorite game of all time and I cant wait to see what the future holds. The latest season (Invasion) is truly the best season yet. I cant wait for what this season holds and all the future seasons.

Je pr√©cise : ne faites pas attention aux avis n√©gatifs ce n'est clairement pas vis√© sur le jeu mais ce sont des haters qui d√©teste BLIZZARD, le studio de d√©veloppement du jeu. Le jeu en lui-m√™me est juste le MEILLEUR fps du genre pour moi. Ce jeu est de toute mani√®re r√©ellement plaisant √† jouer et excellent. 

Overwatch n'a pas de r√©el concurrent, c'est le seul fps √† proposer des h√©ros vraiment vari√©s, ils ont tous un gameplay int√©ressant et amusant, un lore, une histoire, des graphismes tr√®s tr√®s jolis, franchement le jeu de mani√®re g√©n√©rale est tr√®s qualitatif. Mises en sc√®nes, animations, on dirait un film PIXAR !
C'est √©galement le seul FPS √† proposer autant de modes de jeux, de contenu, du PVE, des events vraiment travaill√©s. Il faut l'admettre.  
Les gens critiquent mais j'ai beau chercher, aucun autre FPS sur le march√© ne propose tout ce contenu et toute cette qualit√©.
Et le pire c'est que le jeu est essentiellement gratuit.  

La seule chose qu'on pourrait reprocher c'est la boutique de skin payante et un pass de combat mais j'ai envie de dire, quel jeu ne propose pas de skin de nos jours ? Surtout un jeu free to play. Ce n'est que du cosm√©tique. (Le seul r√©el d√©faut sont les prix de la boutique et des choses payantes l√† je suis d'accord)

Au final je fini toujours par retourner sur le jeu. J'ai envie de me faire quelques games tous les soirs, de progresser, les parties sont rapides. Je m'amuse. Je prends du plaisir. C'est le principal non ? 
Le jeu contient de nombreux joueurs et une grosse communaut√©. Les rageux perdront du temps √† venir critiquer et les autres seront en train de s'amuser tout simplement.

The time on steam doesn't matter, we've all put hundreds of hours into Overwatch 1 and entire lives worth of time into Blizzard. Now Activision wears Blizzard like some sort of strange horrid body suit and manipulates our nostalgia.

Overwatch 2 is a terrible cash grab that took the last decent thing that ActiBlizz made and makes a mockery of it as well as it's player base. Begone foul demon, begone back to your greedy grubby little hole and never return to this land. Bold of you to come to a platform that allows it's users to give public feedback and expect anything different than what is happening.

fun

What to say? I was an "onlywatch"er, the term gave to people who watched Seagull and other streamers who played while the game was in a lengthy beta. I was obsessed with the game before it even launched. A time when community feedback was of the utmost importance. Monthly developer updates from Jeff spoke to the community and let everyone know where the game was headed and that it was cared for. Fast forward, the game launched and it was a pop culture phenomenon that took over the world. Friends and I obsessively played for 5 years as the care continued to pour in from the highly respected Blizzard devs. Got an Overwatch tattoo with my crew. Invited a guy I met from Overwatch half way across the continent to my Wedding. I LOVED the game. Then Bobby Kotick decided the $$ numbers weren't big enough. The content was choked. We still played though. A little less frequently but the anticipation of #2 had us holding on. To see what Overwatch has become, it's pathetic. World was their oyster. Rumours of a Netflix Show. An entire sports like league I had tickets to go to. Movies. A new PvE expansion. They went with a "sequel" though. Clear money grab in all ways imaginable. Hands down the worst sequel of all time. Everything they once built has been pissed away for battlepass garbage. The game has lost all sense of direction with mind boggling gameplay changes. The care the developers once had is so very clearly gone. Trend setting, genre defining game no more. I beg of you not to download or play this game. Boycotting this abomination is the only thing that can maybe bring back the game I once loved, but I'm starting to think it's too late. The world could use more heroes, Don't play this game.
For a small indie company they did their best. their best fucking sucks

Overwatch 2 is the new era of Overwatch - Overwatch 2 is the cruel reanimation of the corpse of the greatest fps since Counter Strike.

Overwatch 1 was the accidental creation of a dysfunctional development team, the most promising franchise ever created. The original development team could not handle the lightning they had bottled and squandered their every opportunity. Years later, Overwatch 2 is an attempt by shareholders to extract every possible dollar they can from the IP before it is inevitably given up on by the player base.

The divine spark still remains. This game can be saved. But it will not be. Activision Blizzard, the shareholders and the CEO, Bobby Kotick, see no problem. To them, there is no art to cherish here - only money to be made. That is all it is to them. All it will ever be.

Things will never improve. It has never been more over.
I get it when you want to become Valorant and put all skins behind paywall for profit, but this locking content behind paywall thing is just not acceptable.

pay 15 for incomplete pve that shouldve been there almost a year ago or pay 2 dollars per mvm match in team fortress 2 to be queued with first tour spies and not get that australium. arent modern shooters awesome
–ù–µ—Ç

If you're looking for a cash-grab "live-service" game with battle pass and overpriced microtransactions, guess what? This is your lucky day! Overwatch 2 is a shadow of original Overwatch. While it is still Overwatch at its heart and fun to play, the game is not rewarding at all. Putting heroes and PvE missions (aka Archive event) behind the paywall and replacing lootboxes with battle pass and shop left little to no motivation to play this game whatsoever.

P.S. Thank you Blizzard for putting Overwatch 2 on Steam so I can finally write the brutally honest review and get it off my chest

aber immerhin ist der p0rn content sehr gut :3

I have played this since Overwatch 1,

Only Pro of this game is that the game play feels good and its AAA quality, plus the SFM animations (you know what i mean)

Game bad, they should had never cancelled the PVE mode. 

The Battlepass is horrible to grind so don't bother buying it unless you're planning of making this game your main game for the whole season. Also locking heroes behind it is scummy as hell.

5V5 ain't fun, should had sticked to 6v6 and the whole balancing of this game has ruined the fun of some of the heroes, all for the sake of making this game more competitive viable and look at it now, their Esport is dying.

Also those cosmetics are way to pricey, I've seen better cosmetics for less price and better quality.

Also blizzard bad, we all know the drama behind it and all their F**K up stuff they did behind the scenes.  

OW pretty much cannibalized every hero shooter out there so either go play tf2 instead or hurt yourself playing paladins instead of this garbage.

Overwatch 2 is in everyway worse than Overwatch 1. i played alot of both (not here but on bnet).
There is also no chance to go back to play Overwatch 1. 
Dont play this, dont spend money on this

Game Launches into black screen. SO for my experience doesn't look to even work here, so great!

However I don't need it to run on Steam to tell you how horrific this game has become since playing it since 2018.
This is a cash grab first and foremost, some of the worst MTX you'll ever see in a game. 

This game is walking in reverse at any given moment, new content is hooked to get you to come back, FOMO is here in full. Blatant lies around every corner from the developers, one of the worst developer leads of all time. 

McCree will always remember his name change because of your decisions then to walk back months later to almost put real world John Cena into the game "EnIgMA" ? Its a joke of a game now.

There are plenty of other games for you to enjoy on this platform, just because this game is free doesn't mean that it deserves your time. As much as it hurts me to say this... Its about time we let Blizzard walk into the sunset and hope possibly that Microsoft can lead that back to us...

"The world could always use more hero's", Wish that was the case Overwatch... T_T
